normal.subject: Thanks for contacting us
normal.message:
Nice chatting with you.
Case ID: 100412158922

Here's the transcript of your chat with Apple Support:

Wednesday, Jan 17, 2018 02:54 AM
Duration 21 minutes 13 seconds



Mel

Thanks for contacting Apple Support. My name is Mel. How can I help you?




John Doe

Hi




John Doe

I have a MacBook Pro with Touch ID




John Doe

I just got my laptop repaired




John Doe

The replaced the logic board and the display




John Doe

and now I have a new issue




Mel

I see. Let me do my best to help you with this.Just to check, on the pre-chat, you have entered details for an MacBook Pro 15-inch, is this the Mac that you=E2=80=99re chatting about?




John Doe

Yes




Mel

Thanks




Mel

May I know what issue you are currently having on your MacBook Pro?




John Doe

So whenever I try to login with the Touch ID the OS crashes




Mel

I see. I have some troubleshooting steps here that we can try however, if none of the steps work, I=E2=80=99d like to setup an appointment for you at the nearest store to have your MacBook physically checked. Would that be OK with you?




John Doe

Yes




John Doe

But I'm really frustrated with this cause this is a like repeating thing




John Doe

I have taken this laptop for repair so many times




John Doe

You could actually check my case history




Mel

I understand. I=E2=80=99m truly sorry about this inconvenience. This is definitely not the Apple experience that we would like you to have. Please rest assured that we=E2=80=99ll do everything to help you get your Mac working as expected.




Mel

Is it OK if go over some troubleshooting steps to see if we can resolve the issue today?




John Doe

Sure




Mel

Thanks.




Mel

First, let=E2=80=99s do a couple of resets on your Mac. Please turn off your Mac and unplug all external devices or peripherals from it.




John Doe

I'm actually chatting from the Mac




Mel

Oh sorry about that. Just for the record, may I also have the current macOS running on your Mac?To check, on the top left of your screen, please click on the Apple menu (=EF=A3=BF) then click on About this Mac. You may find it on this format =E2=80=94 10.X.X




John Doe

10.13.2




Mel

Thanks




Mel

Have you tried restarting the Mac in Safe Mode?




John Doe

No not yet




John Doe

I just received this macbook with a new logic board and a fresh installation of the OS




John Doe

It came with Sierra




John Doe

Thats when I found the issue for the first time so I updated to High Sierra still the issue persists




John Doe

Can I disconnect this chat and call apple support ?




Mel

May I know the country where you are currently located?




John Doe

New York, US




Mel

Thanks




Mel

Our phone support team is not yet available at this time. If you want, you can use your phone to get back to this chat using this link =E2=80=94 https://getsupport.apple.com/GetCaseDetails.do?caseid=100412158922We can send a copy of this chat to your email by ticking the option to send it below this chat window. You can then open the email on your phone and follow the link to get back to this case.




John Doe

Thank you. I will call the apple support tomorrow.




John Doe

Thank you again for your help
Sincerely,
Apple Support
TM and copyright © 2018
All Rights Reserved | Privacy Policy | Support

normal.subject: Student Health Winter Break Reminders
normal.message:
As the semester winds down and winter break approaches, here’s what you need to know about health care access. Be prepared for winter break by working with the Student Health Center now. 


Graduating in December? Please Note: you will have access to the Student Health Center until January 8, 2017. Click here for information on post-NYU insurance options and transitioning your care.

Winter Break Hours

The Student Health Center will be closed Saturday, December 24, 2016, to Monday, January 2, 2017. Click here for a complete listing of winter break hours (January 3–22).

Please Note: The Student Health Center will be open with limited services on Tuesday, January 3rd, offering Urgent Care, Counseling & Psychiatry Walk-In, and Pharmacy services.

For information on access to specific services see below

Medical and Counseling Services

Necessary follow-up care
Avoid a last-minute rush by scheduling pre-break follow-up services NOW. This includes getting your lab results and refilling your prescriptions.

Medical services: click here or call (212) 443-1000

Mental health services: (212) 998-4780

Flu shots
It’s not too late to get vaccinated. Do it for yourself and those around you. Make an appointment at the Student Health Center by calling (212) 443-1188 or online at https://shcportal.nyu.edu.

Emergencies
As always, for a life- or limb-threatening emergency, call 911 (or other local emergency services).

Urgent medical needs: Call the SHC main number, (212) 443-1000. A nurse will speak to you about your symptoms and recommend an appropriate course of action.

Urgent mental health needs: Call the Wellness Exchange hotline: (212) 443-9999.

Counseling services
The Wellness Exchange hotline, (212) 443-9999, is available 24/7, and this will not change over winter break. While our offices are closed, NYU Crisis Response Counselors (CRC) will be on call at all times to manage urgent concerns. 

Optometry

If you need to stock up on contact lenses and related supplies before the winter break, call Optometry Services: (212) 443-1260.

Please Note: If you place an online order for contact lenses while the SHC is closed, the order will not be confirmed until the SHC re-opens after winter break on January 4, 2017. 

Prescriptions

The SHC Pharmacy will be closed Saturday, December 24, through Monday, January 2, and will reopen on Tuesday, January 3. Call or stop by before 4:00 pm the 23rd to avoid long last-minute wait times, the SHC Pharmacy will close at 5:00pm on December 23rd.   

Refills at the SHC
If you are taking medications (antibiotics, antidepressants, asthma medication, birth control pills, etc.) prescribed by one of our health care providers, plan to have enough to last throughout your winter break or make arrangements to transfer your prescriptions to another pharmacy.

To refill your prescriptions, stop by the pharmacy during regular business hours. Don’t wait until the 23rd.

If you need a new prescription for medications that you take on an ongoing basis, contact your provider now: make an appointment or send a secure message through https://shcportal.nyu.edu.

Transfer refills
If you can’t make it in for a refill before winter break, you can transfer your prescription to another pharmacy in order to fill it elsewhere. You must do this before the SHC Pharmacy closes on December 23rd at 5:00pm, and we recommend you do it sooner to avoid long last-minute wait times. Here’s how:
1. Call the pharmacy where you want to fill your prescription before December 23rd
2. Give the pharmacy the name of your medication and ask them to call the SHC Pharmacy at (212) 443-1050. 

Using Student Health Insurance Away from NYU

NYU-sponsored Student Health Insurance Plan 
If you need medical attention while the SHC is closed; you may visit a health care provider without a referral. Seeking services from providers in the MagnaCare or MultiPlan Networks will reduce your out-of-pocket expenses. Find a MagnaCare or MultiPlan provider at http://www.chpstudent.com/nyu.

Please refer to the student health insurance guidebooks for Washington Square or Tandon coverage information or call Consolidated Health Plans, the insurance plan administrator: (877) 373-1170.

normal.subject: NYU Waiver Denied
normal.message:
Dear John Doe,

We are unable to approve your waiver of the NYU-sponsored Student Health Insurance Plan.  The information provided indicates your coverage does not meet the University's criteria for acceptable-alternative coverage.  Your waiver has been denied because you answered no to the following question(s):

  • Is your insurance company headquartered and operating in the United States, with a U.S. claims address and customer service telephone number?

  • Will your insurance coverage remain in effect from August 21, 2017 through August 20, 2018?

  • Does your plan provide inpatient hospitalization benefits in the New York City area, including mental health benefits?

  • Does your plan provide outpatient benefits in the New York City area (including office visits, outpatient mental health benefits and laboratory and radiology procedures)? Coverage for emergency only care does not satisfy the requirement.

  • Do you acknowledge that you are responsible for payment of all fees for medical and mental health treatment not covered by your health insurance plan (including but not limited to deductibles, copays, coinsurance and expenses above my policy maximums and benefit limits)?  Do you also understand that some health facilities, including the Student Health Center, may require payment at the time treatment is provided?

If you can demonstrate that you have insurance that meets the criteria to waive coverage, please provide appropriate documentation from your insurance carrier to the NYU Student Health Insurance Services Office before the September 30th, 2017 deadline for review.  If the insurance fee appears on your Statement of Account you will be subject to the payment deadlines of the Bursar.  After September 30th, 2017 you will not be able to change your selection or waive the insurance plans and you will be responsible for payment of the NYU-sponsored Student Health Insurance Plan fee.

The unique confirmation number recorded in our database for this transaction is 200085.  The date of this transaction is August 8, 2017.  Please retain this information and reference it when contacting Consolidated Health Plans with any questions concerning this transaction or your insurance status. 


Please note:  You will need to use the online process again to update your insurance information for the next academic year (2018-2019) by the September 30th fall semester deadline.  Online enrollments/waivers from previous academic years are not rolled forward or renewed. Please be sure to print a copy of this page for your records.  You will also receive this confirmation notice at the e-mail address previously identified. 

If you have any questions, please contact the NYU Student Health Insurance Office at (212) 443-1020.

Sincerely,

NYU Student Health Insurance Services
726 Broadway, Suite 346
New York, NY  10003-9580
P: 212-443-1020F: (212) 443-1011
health.insurance@nyu.edu

normal.subject: Security Is a Snap with the MFA App: Set It Up Today
normal.message:
Security Is a Snap with the MFA App: Set It Up Today


In summer 2016, NYU introduced Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), which helps protect your sensitive information online, to a limited audience. This summer, NYU expanded MFA, making it available as an option for use with NYU websites that require your NYU NetID and password. Starting this fall, its use will be required for those sites.

If you haven’t already enrolled in MFA, we strongly encourage you to register at least two devices now. In most cases, the Duo Mobile app is the best choice for NYU MFA—it’s free and easy to use, and works in areas without internet or cell service, as well as when traveling internationally. Other MFA options, such as a telephone, have a costassociated with them and should only be used if you can’t use the app for some reason. In the event that you do not have access to a mobile device to take advantage of the app, please contact the NYU IT Service Desk.

Even if you’re already using MFA, you can enhance your security experience by taking these steps:
  • Download the Duo Mobile app to each of your mobile devices.
  • Set up your default option to be a mobile device with the app installed (not a telephone).
Have a question? Explore the videos and FAQs on the NYU IT website, or contact the NYU IT Service Desk. Thank you for partnering with us to better protect your and NYU’s information.

- NYU IT Service Desk

normal.subject: 2017 1098-T Tax Form Available
normal.message:
IRS Form 1098-T is entitled "Tuition Statement," and contains information to assist the IRS and you in determining if you are eligible to claim educational related tax credits such as the American Opportunity Credit and Lifetime Learning Tax Credit for 2017.

The Tax Relief Act of 1997 states that educational institutions, such as New York University, are required to file informational returns with the IRS indicating a student's enrollment, and report either amounts billed, or payments received for qualified tuition and related expenses. The 1098-T form contains information that was sent to the IRS by New York University. The form is an informational return for your personal records, and is not required to be submitted with your 2017 tax return. For a list of Frequently Asked Questions regarding this form, please visit the 1098-T section of http://www.nyu.edu/bursar. Your 2017 1098-T form has been issued and is now available for viewing in your Bursar eSuite. In order to view the 1098-T form, please ensure that your pop-up blocker is disabled.

To access your form:

- Log in to NYUHome.
- Select the "Academics" tab.
- Click the "Go" button on the Albert card to log in to Albert.
- Click the "Sign in to Albert" button.
- In Albert, click the "Finances" button.
- Click "View Bursar Account."
- Click the link in the lightbox to continue to the NYU Office of the Bursar eSuite.
- In eSuite, click the "My Account" option and select "Statements" from the drop-down menu.
- All 1098-T forms will be listed in the "1098-T Tax Statement" section. Click the gear icon to view the 1098-T (ensure your pop-up blocker is turned off).

If you did not "Opt In" to paperless forms, you will also receive a copy of your 1098-T in the mail.

For other questions regarding this form, please contact the Office of the Bursar at (212) 998-2806 or bursar.studentaccounts@nyu.edu with your University ID number (the 'N number,' which can be found in the 'Preferences' section of NYUHome).

Student Name --- [ John Doe ]

Sincerely,

New York University
Office of the Bursar
Billing - Financial Aid - Registration - Housing - Meal Plans - nyu.edu/studentlink

normal.subject: Password Expiration Notice #2
normal.message:
------------------------------------------
From: NYU Information Technology
Subject: IMPORTANT: IT notification message for Theodore Kim (tk1931)
------------------------------------------

**********
SECOND NOTICE
**********

This email is a reminder that your NetID password will soon expire and you must change it now by going to the NYU Start Page ( https://start.nyu.edu ) and following the instructions there.

If you do not change your password before it expires, you will not be able to log into many NYU online services until it is reset. See below for details from the first notice we sent to you.


**********
ORIGINAL MESSAGE
**********
As part of our ongoing efforts to maintain computer security at NYU, Information Technology requires everyone to change the password used with NYUHome and their NetID on a regular basis. This practice helps protect University data, your personal information, and the wide range of services available over the NYU network.

Please reset your NetID password now by going to the NYU Start Page ( https://start.nyu.edu ) and following the instructions provided there.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

YOU MUST CHANGE YOUR NETID PASSWORD BY April 4th, 2017.

If you miss this deadline, you will not be able to access NYUHome, NYURoam wireless and VPN, and other restricted-access web pages and applications that require central NYU NetID authentication until you reset your password on the NYU Start page.

This will also affect you if you are using an email client such as Thunderbird or Outlook to check your email, or if you are using a non-Google application to check your email on your mobile device. You must change your password for continued access to these services. Once changed, you will need to update your saved password in any services affected by the NetID password change.

Please note: Your NetID password is separate and different from your NYU Google Apps password; see the Google link below for more information.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

If you do not change your password, we will send reminder messages prior to the expiration date.

If you change your password before the expiration date, you will not receive any further reminders. If you change your password more frequently than the yearly interval, you can avoid these notices altogether.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

If you have questions, please contact the NYU IT Service Desk, available 24x7.

For more detailed instructions on how to change your NetID password, visit:
http://www.nyu.edu/it/netid

For answers to FAQs about passwords and password changing, browse the NYU ServiceLink knowledge base:
http://www.nyu.edu/servicelink/keyword/netid+password

For more information about Google Apps for Education, visit:
http://www.nyu.edu/google

Thank you for your cooperation in keeping our University systems and data secure.

- NYU Information Technology

normal.subject: Bill Notification: Spring 2018 Term
normal.message:
Your Spring 2018 term bill is now available for review and payment in the NYU Electronic Suite (eSuite). This bill may include tuition, student health insurance, and/or housing.

Payment is due January 4, 2018.

To view your bill, visit nyu.edu/bursar/esuite.

To request a waiver of NYU's mandatory student health insurance coverage, visit nyu.edu/shc/insurance.

In order for parents, guardians, or other authorized payers to view and/or pay your bill, you must add them as an authorized user in eSuite. To set up an authorized user, visit nyu.edu/bursar/esuite.

For any questions please contact us at 212-998-2806 or bursar.studentaccounts@nyu.edu (please provide name and University ID, aka N-number, which can be found in the Student Center in Albert). Visit nyu.edu/studentlink for a schedule of our office hours.

======== STATEMENT DETAILS ==========
Student Name --- [ John Doe ]
=====================================

Thank you,

Anthony Bonano
Bursar

Billing - Financial Aid - Registration - Housing - Meal Plans - nyu.edu/studentlink

normal.subject: Important: Your FSA ID Information Was Changed
normal.message:
Dear Theodore,

—Why We Are Contacting You—

This e-mail is to alert you that your FSA ID information was recently changed.

—What You Need To Do—

If you made the changes, or requested the changes via customer service, you can ignore this e-mail. If you did not make any changes, you may want to change your password. To change your password, go to https://fsaid.ed.gov and select the Manage My FSA ID tab. Enter your username, password, and select CONTINUE. Select the Change My Password link and follow the instructions on screen. Note: You can also review your account information while you are logged in to Manage My FSA ID.

If you have any questions or need help, visit https://fsaid.ed.gov and select Help for more details.

Thank you,

U.S. Department of Education

Federal Student Aid

This mailbox is unattended. Please do not reply to this message.
